title: Frequently asked questions
description: People weigh up coaching alongside careers, family and relocation. These answers reflect what service clients ask most often.

descriptions.career-return: Questions people re-entering paid work often want answered before we begin.
descriptions.graduate-start: Guidance for graduates settling into their first or second role.
descriptions.immigrant-job: Reassurance for internationally mobile professionals navigating the UK market.

items.question: How often do we meet and how long do sessions last?
items.answer: Most pathways meet every two to three weeks for 60–75 minutes. Graduates sometimes prefer 50-minute calls, and urgent transitions may use weekly sprints for a short period.

items.question: Where do sessions take place?
items.answer: Sessions are primarily online via Zoom so we can support people across time zones. In-person intensives in London or Cambridge happen a few times a year when they genuinely help.

items.question: Can I pause or end coaching?
items.answer: Yes. Agreements are reviewed every quarter and you can pause between sessions, shift to lighter check-ins, or wrap up once the goals are met.

items.question: How do I know if coaching is the right space right now?
items.answer: Use the Readiness checklist for a fuller look at when coaching helps and when other professionals are a better first step. Mention any concerns during the 20-minute chat so we can plan together.

items.question: Can my employer or sponsor be involved?
items.answer: Yes. We co-design what updates, if any, will be shared outside sessions. Sponsors only receive information you authorise.

items.question: What if I need to pause because of caring responsibilities?
items.answer: We build in flexible cadences from the start. You can pause or spread out sessions — momentum matters more than speed.

items.question: Is there homework between sessions?
items.answer: We agree small experiments between sessions. They are co-designed so they feel doable alongside study, work, or caregiving.

items.question: Do you offer preparation before performance reviews?
items.answer: We rehearse conversations, co-write talking points and identify evidence to bring into the room with confidence.

items.question: Can we review my CV or LinkedIn profile?
items.answer: Yes. Coaching time can include narrative and document reviews so that every application reflects your story.

items.question: How soon can we start?
items.answer: Intro chats are usually available within two weeks. Paid sessions start as soon as contracts and invoices are complete.

items.question: Do you work internationally?
items.answer: We regularly support clients across the UK, Europe and Asia-Pacific time zones via online sessions.
